story.kicker_image_caption: Police men standing near Jawahar Bagh in Mathura on Friday, a day after violent clashes with the encroachers. (PTI Photo)

mosimage.caption: Family members of SP City Mukul Dwivedi who lost his life in Thursdays encroachers-police clash, mourn in Mathura on Friday. PTI Photo
Slain SHO Santosh Yadav.

story.storykicker: At the time of clash between police and illegal occupants at Jawahar Bagh, at least 8 police officials were present with Mathura Superintendent of Police (City) Mukul Dwivedi who was killed by encroachers on Thursday.
story.storybody:
According to highly placed sources, policemen fled for their lives when encroachers started beating Mathura Superintendent of Police (City) Mukul Dwivedi after dragging him inside at Jawahar Bagh.

At the time of clash between police and illegal occupants, at least 8 senior police officials were present on the spot with SP Dwivedi who succumbed to injuries on Thursday.

When encroachers started beating SP Dwivedi after dragging him inside, SHO Santosh Yadav (Farah police station) tried to save him and got shot in head. Ironically, every other officer, including area Circle Officer and Inspectors, escaped from the spot immediately without trying to save him.

Policemen who were sent to Jawahar Bagh had not been detailed about the strategy of insiders and their firepower. Armed with 303s, Carbines and SLRs constables faced illegal occupants who were waiting for a severe retaliation incase police attacked them.

Twenty four people, including an SP Dwivedi and SHO Yadav, were killed in the massive clash between police and encroachers while the police arrested 124 people in connection with the incident.

{mosimage} 

Now, Uttar Pradesh administration is inquiring into it. Officials in question may face serious action. Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav has announded 50 lakhs each to kins of SP and SO killed in Mathura violence

ORGANISATION TO FELICITATE OFFICIALS

Jawahar Bagh Sangharsh Samiti will felicitate two police officials posthumously, who lost their lives in the violence, and two senior district officials for their actions during the clashes between police and encroachers in this temple city.

"While SP city Mukul Dwivedi would be felicitated posthumously with title 'Yoddha', SHO Santosh Yadav would also be posthumously felicitated with title 'Parakrami'. District Magistrate Rajesh Kumar and SSP Rakesh Singh would also be felicitated for their bold actions," leader of Jawahar Bagh Sangharsh Samiti Kunvar Narendra Singh said.

The Samiti claimed that it had tried to enter Jawahar Bagh for evicting encroachers on three occasions in the past three months but were prevented from doing so by the district administration to avoid violence.

Singh said despite the huge number of arms possessed by the encroachers, they were evicted from the government land due to the offensive adopted by authorities after the death of two police officers.

ALSO READ:

Operation Mathura mess up: Violence exposes failure of UP Police
